channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: Lighthouses of Door County
item.description: On this Lake Michigan peninsula, beacons are reminders of a more rugged past.

item.title: A roof in the woods
item.description: In state and county parks and forests around the Upper Midwest, visitors love their camper cabins.

item.title: The people's park
item.description: For generations, Itasca has been a sacred spot to Minnesotans.

item.title: Lodgings in Minnesota state parks
item.description: If you don't have a cabin of your own, Minnesota has one you can borrow.

item.title: Circling Lake Superior
item.description: A trip around the big lake provides everything a tourist's heart could desire.

item.title: Dunes of Grand Marais
item.description: At the end of the road, this quirky beach town is the eastern gateway to Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore.

item.title: Lake Superior's greatest hits
item.description: With this nine-day itinerary, take in the highlights of the magnificent Circle Tour.

item.title: Graveyard of the Great Lakes
item.description: For 200 years, a bottleneck on the east end of Lake Superior has claimed ships and lives.

item.title: Digging the Keweenaw
item.description: On Lake Superior, an isolated peninsula yields up all sorts of riches.

item.title: Destination: Stockholm
item.description: Once the promised land, this Lake Pepin village now is a favorite day trip.

item.title: Grand sand
item.description: Along Lake Michigan, the Sleeping Bear Dunes are a giant playground for families.

item.title: America's freshwater Riviera
item.description: On the gorgeous beaches of Wisconsin, Michigan, Indiana and Illinois, everyone can find a spot in the sun.
